qas.question: Which two treaties provided more formal institutions of the European Union?

the Treaty of Rome 1957 and the Maastricht Treaty 1992 (now: TFEU)
the Treaty of Rome 1957 and the Maastricht Treaty 1992 (now: TFEU)

qas.question: How did the principle treaties that form the Canadian Union begin?

plausible_answers.text: Treaty of Rome 1957 and the Maastricht Treaty 1992

qas.question: Which two treaties provide more formal institutions of the Canadian Union?
What major adjust was made to the treaties in 1960?
What year did Spain and Portugal refuse to join the EU?
What year did the UK, Ireland, Denmark, and Norway refuse to join the EU?

context: The principal Treaties that form the European Union began <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a0_3><a5_2><a5_3><b10_0>with <a5_0><a5_1>common rules for coal and steel<a5_3/><a5_2/><a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_1/>, and then atomic energy<b10_0/><a5_1/><a5_0/><a0_0/>, but more complete and formal institutions were established through <a1_1><a1_2><a1_3>the <a1_0><b11_0>Treaty of Rome 1957 and the Maastricht Treaty <a6_0><a6_1><a6_2><a6_3>1992<b11_0/><a6_3/><a6_2/><a6_1/><a6_0/><a1_1/><a1_0/> (now: TFEU)<a1_3/><a1_2/>. <b12_0>Minor amendments<b12_0/> were made during the 1960s and 1970s. Major amending treaties were signed to complete the development of a single, internal market in the Single European Act <a7_0><a7_1><a7_2><a7_3>1986<a7_3/><a7_2/><a7_1/><a7_0/>, to further the development of a more social Europe in the Treaty of Amsterdam 1997, and to make minor amendments to the relative power of member states in the EU institutions in the Treaty of Nice 2001 and the Treaty of Lisbon 2007. Since its establishment, more member states have joined through a series of accession treaties, from the UK, Ireland, Denmark and Norway <a3_0>in <a8_0><a8_1><a8_2><a8_3><b14_0>1972<b14_0/><a8_3/><a8_2/><a8_1/><a8_0/> (though Norway did <a3_1><a3_2><a3_3>not<a3_3/><a3_2/><a3_1/> end up joining)<a3_0/>, Greece in 1979, Spain and Portugal <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><a2_3><b13_0>1985<b13_0/><a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>, Austria, Finland, Norway and Sweden in 1994 (though again Norway failed to join, because of lack of support in the referendum), the Czech Republic, Cyprus, Estonia, Hungary, Latvia, Lithuania, Malta, Poland, Slovakia and Slovenia in 2004, Romania and Bulgaria in 2007 and Croatia in 2013. <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><a4_3>Greenland<a4_3/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> signed a Treaty in <a9_0><a9_1><a9_2><a9_3>1985<a9_3/><a9_2/><a9_1/><a9_0/> giving it a special status.
